content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #77094 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
Seems hard to prioritize without any repro
agreed
So at this point all we can do is ask for an msve?
@James Gill I think so
otherwise we could kind of guess a priority until we see more concrete data and adjust

for instance, if someone claims something very bad about their application but we do not have their code I guess I'd just mark it as P-critical anyway and wait or try to discover what could have gone wrong

Thanks for the explanation I asking for more procdure understanding than anything so glad for it, normally would an issue marked in this way just live indefinetely until the owner either closes or provides an msve.

Santiago Pastorino said:

for instance, if someone claims something very bad about their application but we do not have their code I guess I'd just mark it as P-critical anyway and wait or try to discover what could have gone wrong

is not something really actionable but I guess it's nice to raise awareness of a potential huge problem we may be having
I also suppose in your example, getting your issue marked as critical is deffo going to give you a nudge to provide an msve (you'd hope atleast)
@James Gill FYI, MCVE means « Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example »
Thanks I read it meant that on the tags list so sorry if I used it in a confusing/dodgy way
Just realised my brain types msve instead of mcve haha
My bad
always thought the C was correct, and not sure what V was :grinning:

Santiago Pastorino said:

otherwise we could kind of guess a priority until we see more concrete data and adjust

So this issue can stay unprioritized until we have more info, right?

apiraino said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

otherwise we could kind of guess a priority until we see more concrete data and adjust

So this issue can stay unprioritized until we have more info, right?

yes or we can try to guess a priority
We now have repurposed the label S-waiting-on-author and assigned it to this issue
I guess after seeing the new messages on this issue I'd categorize this one as P-high or P-critical
thoughts?
to be honest I don't think we have enough to really understand (at least I dont). Moreover, the original reporter didnt reply yet
only hint we have is this from simulacrum but not sure it's confirmed by the facts
I mean, we could slap a P-high/I-nominate and move forward, but I would avoid chocking the agenda with unclear issues (as far as possible for us)
simulacrum made a PR (#77634) that they thought would fix #76980 - I believe the pre-release has the fix. Maybe we can get someone who can repro #77094 to try the pre-release?
ah that would be interesting. Perhaps also the other github user invis87 that joined the discussion
I'll post a comment about it
thanks!
do we have new info about this one?
none, as far as I know. I was thinking that perhaps in a couple of days we can remove the I-prioritize label temporarily until something happen to help us better understand
By the way is there a policy for issues waiting for a feedback from the reporter for more than X days?
Apply S-waiting-on-author?
Issue #77094's prioritization request has been removed.
Removed prioritization until we have more info
